multi_currency.title: Multi-Currency & Language

introduction.heading: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: Welcome to InvoiceTrackr ("we," "our," or "us"). We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our invoice tracking and management service.

personal_info.heading: 2.1 Personal Information
personal_info.intro: When you register for an account, we collect:

financial_info.heading: 2.2 Financial Information
financial_info.intro: To enable invoice functionality, we collect:

items.banking: Banking information (bank name, code, and account number)
items.invoice: Invoice data including amounts, dates, and payment statuses

payment_info.heading: 2.3 Payment Information
payment_info.content: Payment processing is handled by Stripe, a third-party payment processor. We do not store your credit card information. We only retain your Stripe customer ID and subscription ID for account management purposes.

usage_info.heading: 2.4 Usage Information
usage_info.intro: We automatically collect certain information about your device and how you interact with our service:

analytics_data.heading: 2.5 Analytics Data
analytics_data.intro: We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors use our website. Google Analytics collects information such as how often users visit our site, what pages they visit, and what other sites they used prior to visiting. We use this information to improve our service and user experience. Google Analytics may use cookies and other tracking technologies. You can learn more about Google's privacy practices at

how_we_use.heading: 3. How We Use Your Information
how_we_use.intro: We use the collected information for the following purposes:

items.provide: To provide, operate, and maintain our invoice tracking service
items.create: To create and manage your account
items.process: To process your transactions and manage subscriptions
items.generate: To generate, store, and export invoices and contracts
items.send: To send invoice-related emails to your clients
items.display: To display your income dashboard and financial analytics
items.support: To provide customer support and respond to your inquiries
items.admin: To send administrative information and service updates
items.improve: To improve our service and develop new features
items.analyze: To analyze usage patterns and trends
items.detect: To detect and prevent fraud or unauthorized access

how_we_share.heading: 4. How We Share Your Information
how_we_share.intro: We do not sell your personal information. We may share your information in the following circumstances:

service_providers.heading: 4.1 Service Providers
service_providers.intro: We share information with third-party service providers who perform services on our behalf:

items.cloudinary: Image hosting for profile pictures and other media

legal.heading: 4.2 Legal Requirements
legal.content: We may disclose your information if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g., a court or government agency).

business_transfers.heading: 4.3 Business Transfers
business_transfers.content: In the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, your information may be transferred as part of that transaction.

data_security.heading: 5. Data Security
data_security.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. These measures include:

items.encryption: Encryption of data in transit using SSL/TLS

data_security.disclaimer: However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

data_retention.heading: 6. Data Retention
data_retention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law. When you delete your account, we will delete or anonymize your personal information, except where we are required to retain it for legal, tax, or accounting purposes.

your_rights.heading: 7. Your Rights and Choices
your_rights.intro: Depending on your location, you may have the following rights regarding your personal information:

access.title: Access
access.description: Request access to your personal information

deletion.title: Deletion
deletion.description: Request deletion of your personal information

portability.title: Portability
portability.description: Request a copy of your data in a structured format

withdraw.title: Withdraw consent
withdraw.description: Withdraw consent where processing is based on consent

your_rights.outro: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided in the "Contact Us" section below.

cookies.heading: 8. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track activity on our service and store certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are stored on your device. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some features of our service.

third_party_links.heading: 9. Third-Party Links
third_party_links.content: Our service may contain links to third-party websites or services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these third parties. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third-party sites you visit.

children_privacy.heading: 10. Children's Privacy
children_privacy.content: Our service is not intended for individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 18. If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so we can delete it.

international_transfers.heading: 11. International Data Transfers
international_transfers.content: Your information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. These countries may have data protection laws that are different from the laws of your country. We take appropriate measures to ensure that your personal information remains protected in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

changes.heading: 12. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.

contact.heading: 13. Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at:

agreement.heading: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreement.content: By accessing or using InvoiceTrackr ("Service," "we," "our," or "us"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms, you may not access or use the Service.

description.heading: 2. Description of Service
description.intro: InvoiceTrackr is an online invoice generation, tracking, and management platform designed for freelancers and small businesses. Our Service provides:

items.dashboard: Financial dashboard with income analytics and charts
items.banking: Banking information storage for invoicing purposes

creation.heading: 3.1 Account Creation
creation.intro: To access certain features of the Service, you must register for an account. You agree to:

items.accurate: Provide accurate, current, and complete information
items.security: Maintain the security of your password and account
items.responsibility: Accept all responsibility for activities that occur under your account
items.notify: Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account
items.maintain: Maintain and promptly update your account information

eligibility.heading: 3.2 Account Eligibility
eligibility.content: You must be at least 18 years old to create an account and use the Service. By creating an account, you represent and warrant that you meet this age requirement.

free.heading: 4.1 Free Plan
free.content: Our free plan allows you to create unlimited invoices, use basic invoice templates, export to PDF, and add your signature.

premium.heading: 4.2 Premium Plan
premium.content: Our premium plan ($4.99/month) includes all free features plus the ability to save and edit invoices, store client information, create and manage contracts, choose currency and language preferences, and email invoices directly to clients.

payment.heading: 4.3 Payment Terms
payment.content: Premium subscriptions are billed monthly in advance. Payment processing is handled securely by Stripe, a third-party payment processor. By subscribing to a premium plan, you authorize us to charge your payment method on a recurring basis.

cancellation.heading: 4.4 Cancellation and Refunds
cancellation.content: You may cancel your subscription at any time through your account settings. Cancellations will take effect at the end of your current billing period. We do not provide refunds for partial months of service or unused features.

your_content.heading: 5.1 Your Content
your_content.content: You retain all rights to the content you create, upload, or store through the Service, including invoices, client information, and other data ("Your Content"). By using the Service, you grant us a limited license to use, store, and process Your Content solely to provide and improve the Service.

responsibility.heading: 5.2 Content Responsibility
responsibility.intro: You are solely responsible for Your Content and the consequences of posting or publishing it. You represent and warrant that:

items.own: You own or have the necessary rights to Your Content
items.rights: You own or have the necessary rights to Your Content
items.laws: Your Content does not violate any applicable laws or regulations
items.viruses: Your Content does not contain viruses or malicious code

backup.heading: 5.3 Data Backup
backup.content: While we implement backup procedures, you are responsible for maintaining your own backups of Your Content. We are not liable for any loss or corruption of Your Content.

acceptable_use.heading: 6. Acceptable Use Policy
acceptable_use.intro: You agree not to use the Service to:

items.infringe: Infringe upon the rights of others
items.transmit: Transmit fraudulent, false, or misleading information
items.fraudulent: Create fraudulent invoices or engage in financial fraud
items.unauthorized: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Service or other users' accounts
items.interfere: Interfere with or disrupt the Service or servers
items.automated: Use automated systems (bots, scrapers) without our written permission
items.resell: Resell or redistribute the Service without authorization
items.illegal: Use the Service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose

our_rights.heading: 7.1 Our Rights
our_rights.content: The Service and its original content, features, and functionality are owned by InvoiceTrackr and are protected by international copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret, and other intellectual property laws. Our trademarks and trade dress may not be used without our prior written permission.

feedback.heading: 7.2 Feedback
feedback.content: If you provide us with feedback, suggestions, or ideas about the Service, you grant us the right to use such feedback without any obligation to you.

third_party.heading: 8. Third-Party Services
third_party.intro: The Service integrates with or relies on third-party services, including:
third_party.disclaimer: Your use of these third-party services is subject to their respective terms of service and privacy policies. We are not responsible for the availability, functionality, or practices of these third-party services.

availability.heading: 9.1 Service Availability
availability.content: We strive to maintain high service availability, but we do not guarantee that the Service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free. We may suspend or discontinue the Service at any time for maintenance, updates, or other reasons.

modifications.heading: 9.2 Service Modifications
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any aspect of the Service at any time without notice. We may also modify these Terms at any time. Your continued use of the Service after such modifications constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

disclaimers.heading: 10. Disclaimers
disclaimers.intro: THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:

items.merchantability: Warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement
items.accuracy: Warranties regarding the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of the Service
items.uninterrupted: Warranties that the Service will be uninterrupted or error-free
items.defects: Warranties that defects will be corrected

disclaimers.disclaimer: You acknowledge that InvoiceTrackr is a tool for invoice management and that you are responsible for the accuracy and legality of the invoices you create. We do not provide financial, legal, or tax advice.

limitation.heading: 11. Limitation of Liability
limitation.intro: TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, INVOICETRACKR SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR:

items.indirect: Any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages
items.loss: Loss of profits, revenue, data, or use
items.content: Loss of or damage to Your Content
items.use: Any damages resulting from your use or inability to use the Service
items.third_party: Any damages resulting from third-party services or integrations

limitation.cap: IN NO EVENT SHALL OUR TOTAL LIABILITY EXCEED THE AMOUNT YOU PAID TO US IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE LIABILITY, OR $100, WHICHEVER IS GREATER.

indemnification.heading: 12. Indemnification
indemnification.intro: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless InvoiceTrackr and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in any way connected with:

items.access: Your access to or use of the Service
items.third_party: Your violation of any third-party rights
items.content: Your Content or any invoices you create

by_you.heading: 13.1 Termination by You
by_you.content: You may terminate your account at any time by contacting us or through your account settings.

by_us.heading: 13.2 Termination by Us
by_us.intro: We may suspend or terminate your access to the Service at any time, with or without cause or notice, including if:

items.security: Your use of the Service poses a security risk
items.fraud: You engage in fraudulent or illegal activities
items.law: We are required to do so by law

effect.heading: 13.3 Effect of Termination
effect.content: Upon termination, your right to use the Service will immediately cease. We may delete Your Content in accordance with our data retention policies. Provisions of these Terms that by their nature should survive termination shall survive, including intellectual property rights, disclaimers, limitations of liability, and dispute resolution provisions.

governing_law.heading: 14. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
governing_law.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which InvoiceTrackr operates, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any disputes arising from these Terms or your use of the Service shall be resolved through binding arbitration, except that either party may seek injunctive relief in court for intellectual property infringement or violations of these Terms.

entire.heading: 15.1 Entire Agreement
entire.content: These Terms, together with our Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and InvoiceTrackr regarding the Service.

severability.heading: 15.2 Severability
severability.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

waiver.heading: 15.3 Waiver
waiver.content: Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms shall not be deemed a waiver of such right or provision.

assignment.heading: 15.4 Assignment
assignment.content: You may not assign or transfer these Terms or your rights under them without our prior written consent. We may assign these Terms without restriction.

contact.heading: 16. Contact Information
contact.intro: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at:
